11.content:
"God I hate exams!" your best friend and roommate, Henry Park mutters as he hurriedly skims through his calculus textbook.

The two of you were sitting at a table in the Physics building's main eating area. You were just finishing up a slice of Pizza as Henry crammed for a test he had in two hours. All around you there were other University Students hurriedly eating their lunches before the afternoon exams started. Outside the building, it was blizzarding at the glorious temperature of -40. If but for the weather you would have gone home by now as you were done exams for the day.

Suddenly the floor beneath you shook and you felt a burst of heat course through your body. Your eyes were blinded by a bright light and your muscles started to spasm. Then it was all over and you blacked out.

When you came to, you were laying on your back on the ground. People were standing around you, looking down at you.

"You alright man?" asked Henry.

"Yeah, I'm fine," you reply, "What happened?"

"You just started to shake," was Henry's reply.

"Well, I'm fine now," you reply cooly, returning once again to a standing position.

Slowly the crowd that had gathered around you departed back for their food and books. Sitting down again you return to your pizza and Henry returns to his studying.

"Hey Jakey!" a familiar sing-song voice coos from behind you.

Turning around you come face to face with your girlfriend of three months, Nancy Burns. You reach out a hand and she takes it. The next thing to happen was wholly unlike anything you'd ever experienced before. Your mind was wrenched from your body...

You found yourself in a dimly lit room. You were seated in a chair and in front of you was a strange control pad. Looking around you could faintly make out curved metal walls, covered in embossed text. Turning back to the control pad you focus your attention on a small dial. Around the dial you saw different words printed. The words were:

body, part, memory, personality, age, life & none


The dial was currently pointing at 'none'. Beside the dial there was a switch that had two positions, labeled: 'Read Mem.' and 'Swap' For that switch, you saw that it was in the 'swap' position. Beside the switch was a large green button and a sign that read: "Nancy Burns, age 20" Aside from that, you saw a regular keyboard as well as a projector, mounted on the far side of the console.

Slowly pushing your way through the throng of people, you then proceed towards the nearby Fine Arts building. Once back in a warm building, you brush snow off of your clothes and shake your head a bit to get it out of your hair. This results in hair winding up in your face. Once you clear the hair from your face, you look up to see a slightly younger guy staring at you.

"Sorry Bro, this gal's taken," you say to him, causing him to resume his travel down the corridor.

"Nancy? Is that you?" you hear a feminine voice squeal.

You turn and come face to face with a taller girl with straight black hair. The girl was struggling to carry a large sheet of painted plywood as well as a can of paint, a couple of paintbrushes, a backpack and a roll of cloth. On her face, you saw a few smudges of paint and her clothes were all covered in spots of paint, sawdust and fuzz from the cloth.

"It's so nice to see you again!" beams the girl, trying desperately to keep a hold on her load.

"Here, let me help you with that," you offer, guessing that this is one of Nancy's friends.

You reach for the roll of cloth but the girl offers you the paintbucket and brushes instead.

"Hand me the cloth," you demand, reaching for the large roll.

"Nu-uh!" replies the girl, "No way you can carry it."

Flustered by the derogatory statement about your strength you grab for the roll and pull it out from under the girl's arm. Once you are fully supporting the roll you tip forwards and fall to one knee.

"Told you so Nance!" laughs the girl, struggling to reach out a hand to help you up.

"Just give me a moment!" you shout in reply, blushing in embarrassment.

Moving to the middle of the roll you grip it tightly and try to lift it off the ground. This time you wind up falling to both knees and fully dropping the roll to the ground. Collapsing onto the ground you glow bright red from embarrassment.

"Here! Let me help you with that!" a male voice calls out.

You turn your head and see the boy you brushed off earlier running over. He gracefully helps you to your feet and then heaves the roll up onto his shoulder.

"Thanks," you say to him, still glowing hotly.

"No problem," he replies, carting the roll off down the hall, followed by the girl who had greeted you, walking backwards.

Looking down you see that the girl had left you the paint can and brushes to carry.

"Come on Nance!" shout out the girl, gesturing for you to catch up.

Brushing yourself off you pick up the paint can and cart it off in pursuit of the girl.

Once in the destination room for everything, the guy departs after a curt farewell.

"See? What did I tell you about the cloth?" joked the tall girl, placing the plywood on a rack with other similar sheets.

"You are really strong," you reply, remarking on how she had been carrying not only the cloth but the plywood, paint, brushes and a backpack.

"That is what you get from carting that stuff around all the time!" snickers the girl.

"I guess," you reply shyly.

"So, what have you been up to recently?" asked the girl, dropping the bag onto the floor.

You are once again fully conscious of whose body you inhabit. You have no idea who this girl actually is, never mind what to tell her. You and Nancy had only been together for a few months, before which time the two of you had spent very little time together. You had only ever met one or two of her friends and, even then, only for a few minutes.
